captions.text: Welcome to the League of Legends Champion Spotlight featuring Evelynn, the Widowmaker.
Evelynn is a melee assassin who can dart into battles and kill single foes or go toe to toe in larger fights.
Able to jungle or lane as a fighter, Evelynn employs stealth and maneuverability to dismantle the competition.
Evelynn’s passive is Shadow Walk. As long as Evelynn has not recently dealt damage, received damage, or activated an ability, Evelynn is stealthed.
While stealthed, she rapidly regenerates her mana and is undetectable unless she gets revealed by an enemy turret, Vision Ward, or champion.
Evelynn can skirt on the edges of an enemy champion’s vision range, stalking them while undetected.
Hate Spike fires out a line of damaging spikes that prefers to target Evelynn’s most recently attacked foe.
As her main damage tool, take Hate Spike at level 1 and max it immediately.
Dark Frenzy passively grants Evelynn stacking bonus movement speed up to a cap whenever she hits an enemy champion with one of her abilities.
When activated, Dark Frenzy purges all slows from Evelynn and grants Evelynn bonus movement speed.
Dark Frenzy’s cooldown is reset whenever Evelynn kills or assists in the kill of an enemy champion.
Definitely take a point in Dark Frenzy at level 4 or earlier, but max it last, by level 18.
Ravage strikes target enemy twice, dealing damage and granting Evelynn bonus attack speed. To further increase her damage, take a point in Ravage early and max it by level 13.
Evelynn’s ultimate is Agony’s Embrace. Agony’s Embrace hits all enemies in an area, damaging based on maximum health and slowing for a few seconds.
Evelynn also gains a shield that gets more powerful for every enemy champion hit
When jungling as Evelynn, you’ll want to start the game out aggressively, picking up either the Ancient Golem or Elder Lizard with Hate Spike and ganking immediately.
Wait out of sight for Shadow Walk to kick in.
Once invisible, make your way around your opponent and signal your team. Once they’re ready, dive in with Dark Frenzy and use Exhaust to slow your opponent, while damaging with Hate Spike.
Dark Frenzy’s passive lets Evelynn keep pace for First Blood. Once Twitch falls, Dark Frenzy is refreshed and Evelynn makes her way out alive.
When jungling Evelynn, use Dark Frenzy to get between camps, and position yourself such that Hate Spike hits as many monsters as possible.
The Golems are easy to kill as Evelynn focuses the larger one while moving so that Hate Spike hits both.
Once your opponents buy wards, it’s important you let Shadow Walk kick in well before you get near a lane.
Notice how Evelynn can walk right past the enemy Sight Ward undetected.
Evelynn signals her team and then opens on Twitch with Dark Frenzy and Exhaust, picking up an easy kill with Ravage and Hate Spike before returning to the jungle with Dark Frenzy.
While Evelynn can’t always stop her foes from running, she’s exceptional at chasing them.
Evelynn happens across Skarner in the jungle, opening with Ravage and Hate Spike, then activating Dark Frenzy as Skarner tries to Flash away.
The passive movement bonus from Dark Frenzy allows Evelynn an easy kill before Skarner can reach his turret.
Remember that your opponents can see you enter their jungle if Shadow Walk hasn’t activated yet.
Here Evelynn runs right past a Sight Ward in full view due to her impatience.
Though she drops her own ward to offer early warning and kills the Ancient Golem quickly, the other team is already poised to collapse on her.
Soraka and Skarner arrive, pull Evelynn back with Impale, and manage to delay long enough for Orianna to close in for the kill.
As long as you can get away with it, stealing monsters from your opponents, or counter-jungling, is a great way to build an advantage over your enemy.
To do this most effectively, kill the largest monster in the camp first and make sure to leave just one of the smaller monsters alive.
This way your opponents get almost no gold from them.
Evelynn should focus on singling out important targets. Noticing Orianna toss The Ball out from behind the trees, Evelynn turns to chase her down.
Dark Frenzy and Agony’s Embrace open the fight, while Hate Spike and Ravage keep Dark Frenzy’s passive stacked.
Because Hate Spike will ready the bonus damage from Trinity Force, constantly try to land basic attacks to kill your opponents quickly.
As soon as Orianna falls, Dark Frenzy gets Evelynn back with her team, ready to start another fight.
The best way to handle team fights is to find stranded enemies and come in from behind.
In the aftermath of a fight, Evelynn’s team is forced to run, but she waits off on the side for Shadow Walk to activate.
Once she comes around behind the enemy team, she keeps Varus in range without being detected.
Biding her time, she waits for Soraka and Skarner to move away as Varus retreats.
Immediately, Evelynn opens with Ravage and Hate Spike, dealing tons of damage to Varus and taking him down.
Immediately after, Dark Frenzy lets Evelynn regroup with her team, landing Agony’s Embrace on Skarner and Soraka, taking them down and saving her teammate, Twitch.
I recommend building Evelynn with damage, toughness, and mobility in mind, and specifically as a jungler on Summoner’s Rift.
Consider Flat Attack Damage Marks, Flat Armor Seals, Magic Resist Per Level Glyphs, and Movement Speed Quintessences.
Try 14/16/0 Masteries, getting both Armor and Magic Penetration in Offense, plus minion damage reduction, Health, and Movement Speed in Defense.
For Summoner Spells, take Smite when jungling, Exhaust for ganks, Ignite for damage output, or Flash for safety.
Open with Boots of Speed, Health Potions, and grab Prospector’s Blade in Dominion or Wriggle’s Lantern in Classic.
Take Sheen and upgraded boots as quickly as possible then upgrade to Trinity Force. From here, you should assess the game:
Wit’s End, Maw of Malmortius, Randuin’s Omen, and Guardian Angel will provide a mix of damage and toughness if you need the added survivability.
To focus on assassination, consider Deathfire Grasp, Infinity Edge, Bloodthirster or Sanguine Blade, and Last Whisper.
Thanks for tuning into the Evelynn Champion Spotlight. Please subscribe to the Riot Games YouTube channel above and leave us your comments just below the video!

comments.author: Hui Chang

comments.text:
Eve doesn't have a great spot in the current meta, but I still main her.
My personal build for her goes:
-Mobility Boots
-Hextech Gunblade
-Blade of the Ruined King
-Ravenous Hydra
-Trinity Force / Lich Bane 
-Stalker's Blade Enchantment Magus

I play her as a single target assassin that searches for isolated units and 
bursts them down in a short enough time to reposition and not be caught.

Ability Leveling for me goes:
R>Q>E>W

Put your Gunblade, BotRK, and Hydra on your 1/2/3 keys.
While in stealth rush into someone and hit all three of the actives at once.
Then hit your E and let her auto attack while hitting Q to get as many Hate 
Spikes as possible out.
The immense amount of Lifesteal and Spellvamp should keep you alive while 
destroying one person.
Then , use her W to swiftly get away and back into position to assassinate 
another target.﻿
comments.author: Terezi Redglare Pyrope

comments.text:
+Skii Ti i play her as a mid laner (sorta) into low plat and just play her 
as an ad offtank, much like his build but subing hydra for a tank item. 
Usually start flash and just cs safely, using q when needed, rushing mobis 
and immediately helping out my team. If my duo partner is there (more 
specifically if hes jungling) he can cover my lane, soaking up xp and gold 
while i help out other lane, using her better than average ganks bot lane 
with a decent cc heavy support like leo or thresh. But the late game is 
usually VERY strong. Just a thought, u might think its fun.
comments.author: DowhopZigZagJelloPopRudyZiggetyZaggity Puddin

comments.text:
+Terezi Redglare Pyrope Tried that build just like you said :D was fun in 
normals but I'd like to point out some few problems. Your build would be 
fun to play if she continues the constant snowballing in the game. But the 
major problem is that junglers in general don't gain much gold compared to 
the laners, and all the items listed above might seem too pricey, therefore 
slowing up her build speed when her early-mid game is her best phase. 
For a safe build that would be most ideal for ranked would be going 
tank-like after upgrading the warrior enhancement. I go 21/9/0, Flat AP 
glyphs and quints with armor seals and flat AD marks for early game 
jungling and higher starting power.
AP assassin eve was definitely fun in season 3 with her E being magic 
damage with DFG proc. But now her her standing position is weak due to the 
existence of much better assassins, going full tank would be most ideal for 
her.
Not to mention tank eve manages out skirmishes safe even by forcibly 
initiating the teamfight.

her she is incredibly powerful. Ganking is crazy good cause of stealth, she 
does amazing damage per sec and can build some tankiness if she needs to.

comments.text:
On the new summoner's rift, I'd suggest the same builds offered above; but 
building differently. Rush boots of speed as normal, but afterwards get 
guish's and gunblade, following up with semi-building void staff and last 
whisper to finish off afterwards, filling in the blanks with triforce.

EDIT: For jungle, rush the jungle item first (enchanting with mage) and 
begin building boots of mobility fully (unenchanted.) Then, begin building 
AD / AP blend items, such as guish's gunblade and hextech gunblade. After 
that get the components for last whisper and void staff to quickly allow 
assassinations of seperated units, spite if they built armor or not.﻿

comments.author: Aj Taz

comments.text:
I think that the only thing that needs a change is the price of pink wards 
since they are much less useful than stealth wards. I would change the 
pricing or add a lot more hit points. Alternatively you could have a 
trinket, with a longer cooldown than sweeping lens, that can place a pink 
ward.
comments.author: lectricanman

comments.text:
To be fair, you need to play to your opponents strengths. Get a pink ward 
early in bot and place it in the river bush after a little time has passed. 
Make sure to use a sweeping lens to clear out enemy stealth wards before 
placing the pink or else they'll know to Deward it. Also make sure to play 
aggressively in order to keep the other team from getting to your pink 
ward. It will set you back significantly in gold but you probably won't get 
ganked as much.

for that. But if every skin of your champion is dressed like that, I'm 
sorry but your skins aren't going to have much variety. If you chaged her 
clothes to white people still couldn't see a huge difference due to how 
little she's wearing. In order for her to have a cool skin, she has to, you 
know, be wearing something to look cool. Otherwise it's literally just

comments.text:
You obviously didn't think about my comment or read the previous comments 
to understand the context. 

I will edit my comment here so it makes sense for you. Edits will be in 
*bold*.
*Evelynn is stronger in season 4 because of the removal of* Oracles *which 
can no longer be* against her. Oracles granted *the enemy team* true sight, 
rendering Evelynn's passive ineffective *as Evelynn is revealed by true 
sight*.
